name: Sudden drop in synthetic calls
description:
Detects a rapid drop in the values of the calls KPI metric relative to the values in the last 30 minutes. The magnitude of the drop in calls should also exceed the relative and absolute threshold parameters below.
This rule is powered by a generic sudden drop/increase detector which is based on a modified version of the E-Divisive with Medians (EDM) algorithm for detection of changes in distribution of values of a given metric over the time.

fields.name: content
fields.value:
1. Review the data stream configuration to ensure that the data stream is properly ingesting and processing the required metrics.
2. Validate the data quality and completeness of the calls data.
3. Investigate any potential issues with the underlying infrastructure or services that may be impacting the call data generation.
4. If the issue persists, consider adjusting the relative and absolute threshold parameters of the rule to better match the specific situation and avoid false positives or negatives.
5. Monitor the metric over time to ensure that the issue has been fully resolved and that the system is stable again.

If none of these steps resolve the issue, it may be necessary to contact support for further assistance.
